revised_title: Foraminifera Species Distribution in the North Atlantic and Arctic Oceans
tldr: This article presents a study of Foraminifera species distribution in the North Atlantic and Arctic Oceans, including Davis Strait and Baffin Bay. The authors collected specimens from various locations and analyzed their abundance, locations, and relationships. They identified 109 specific and varietal forms, with detailed descriptions and illustrations in the paper. The study provides a comprehensive understanding of the Foraminiferal fauna in the Northern seas and their distribution in other seas as well.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Marine Biology
